intro: Arceuthobium rubrum, commonly known as the red witchweed, is a parasitic plant that relies entirely on host plants for its survival. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and lacks chlorophyll, making it unable to perform photosynthesis. The plant produces small, reddish-brown seeds that are dispersed by wind, often attaching to the roots of grasses and other herbaceous plants. It is considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its ability to weaken and sometimes kill its host. Despite its parasitic nature, it has a unique life cycle and plays a role in certain ecosystems.
